messageBody:
junit@yahoogroups.com wrote:

> Whether the "fileset" task includes a class specifically or via
> wildcard, JUnit will instantiate a TestSuite, reflectively find all
> methods in a class that begin with "test", and then attempt to execute
> them. In our cases, there are a number of existing methods which
> begin with "test" but are protected and thus do not get executed.
> However, this leads to test method failures. Now, I could rename
> these methods to avoid the errors, but I am hoping to find a way
> around it so that developers in the future could add methods to
> future test classes without having to worry about not naming them
> test*.

These are the lines in junits TestSuite causing the problem:

if (! isPublicTestMethod(m)) {
if (isTestMethod(m))
addTest(warning("Test method isn't public:
"+m.getName()));
return;
}

Does anyone actually *want* that behaviour??? I wouldn't mind if the warning
simply would be removed.

(BTW, you can work around this behavior by adding a dummy argument to the
method. Not very elegant, I know...)

Cheers, Ilja
